diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with a 3-day history of right upper quadrant and epigastric abdominal pain associated with emesis and nausea, following the consumption of heavy food. Her past medical history includes gallstone pancreatitis and she had previously undergone ERCP and sphincterotomy. The examination revealed mild abdominal distension and tenderness in the right upper quadrant without rebound or guarding, supporting the diagnosis of acute cholecystitis.
